thread.title: Press Release: Kean and Gottheimer Introduce Bipartisan Legislation for Enhanced College Dormitory Fire Safety
thread.title_full: Press Release: Kean and Gottheimer Introduce Bipartisan Legislation for Enhanced College Dormitory Fire Safety

author: Quiver CongressRadar
title: Press Release: Kean and Gottheimer Introduce Bipartisan Legislation for Enhanced College Dormitory Fire Safety
text:
Kean and Gottheimer introduce bipartisan legislation to enhance fire safety standards in college dormitories nationwide.
Quiver AI Summary
Congressman Kean and Gottheimer introduce fire safety legislation: On January 22, 2026, Congressman Tom Kean and Congressman Josh Gottheimer announced the introduction of the Seton Hall Fire Victims Remembrance Act, aiming to establish new national fire safety standards for college dormitories. This initiative marks the 26th anniversary of the tragic Boland Hall fire at Seton Hall University.
Legislators emphasize campus safety: Kean stated, “We honor the memory of those lost... by establishing clear federal standards,” while Gottheimer underscored the importance of protecting students. The bill proposes that colleges assess compliance with fire safety measures and aims for regular updates to standards in consultation with fire safety experts.
Legislative background and aim: The Boland Hall fire claimed three lives and injured many others, highlighting serious gaps in fire safety at universities. The proposed legislation mandates the Secretary of Education to develop and regulate fire safety standards for residential facilities, ensuring transparency and accountability in compliance.
Disclaimer: This is an AI-generated summary of a press release. The model used to summarize this release may make mistakes. See the full release here.
Thomas H. Kean, Jr. Fundraising
Thomas H. Kean, Jr. recently disclosed $534.9K of fundraising in a Q3 FEC disclosure filed on October 15th, 2025. This was the 143rd most from all Q3 reports we have seen this year. 70.8% came from individual donors.
Kean disclosed $203.8K of spending. This was the 282nd most from all Q3 reports we have seen from politicians so far this year.
Kean disclosed $2.0M of cash on hand at the end of the filing period. This was the 185th most from all Q3 reports we have seen this year.
You can see the disclosure here, or track Thomas H. Kean, Jr.'s fundraising on Quiver Quantitative.
Thomas H. Kean, Jr. Net Worth
Quiver Quantitative estimates that Thomas H. Kean, Jr. is worth $13.6M, as of January 22nd, 2026. This is the 95th highest net worth in Congress, per our live estimates.
Kean has approximately $3.8M invested in publicly traded assets which Quiver is able to track live.
You can track Thomas H. Kean, Jr.'s net worth on Quiver Quantitative's politician page for Kean.
Thomas H. Kean, Jr. Bill Proposals
Here are some bills which have recently been proposed by Thomas H. Kean, Jr.:
H.R.7168: To direct the Secretary of Education to develop standards for fire suppression systems in dormitories and other residential facilities for students on the campuses of institutions of higher education that receive Federal education funding, and for other purposes.H.R.6647: Drone Safety Enhancement ActH.R.6423: HELP Copays ActH.R.6322: Stop Stealing our Chips ActH.R.6265: Safer GAMING ActH.R.5957: Connecting Veterans to Care Act of 2025
You can track bills proposed by Thomas H. Kean, Jr. on Quiver Quantitative's politician page for Kean.
2026 New Jersey's 7th Congressional District Election
There has been approximately $33,191,856 of spending in New Jersey's 7th congressional district elections over the last two years, per our estimates.
Approximately $17,869,773 of this has been from outside spending by PACs and Super PACs. Some of the groups who are spending money in this race include:
HMP($7,080,571)CONGRESSIONAL LEADERSHIP FUND($6,842,049)WORKING FAMILIES PARTY PAC($1,730,543)AMERICA PAC($1,059,235)JERSEY REAL($319,183)
